title: Defying Congress, Trump Moves to Cut $4.9 Billion in Foreign Aid
summary: The White House notified Congress that it plans to use a legally untested maneuver to circumvent lawmakers and claw back more money for foreign aid programs.

title: In Budget Logs It Tried to Hide, White House Wrests More Control Over Spending
summary: Deep within obscure footnotes, the Trump administration is claiming more of Congress’s constitutional power of the purse by threatening to block funding.

title: Trump Cancels Kamala Harris’s Secret Service Protection
summary: The Secret Service usually protects a former vice president for six months after they leave office, but President Joseph R. Biden Jr. had extended Ms. Harris’s protection beyond that.

title: Grand Juries in D.C. Reject Prosecutors’ Efforts to Level Harsh Charges Against Residents
summary: The extraordinary pushback in at least three separate cases comes as President Trump has flooded the streets with National Guard troops and federal agents.

title: Weapons to Start Flowing Into Ukraine Under European Deal With Trump
summary: A package of U.S. cruise missiles is among the first shipments of purchases by NATO allies to be sent to the embattled country.

title: Ukraine’s Donetsk Faces Water Crisis Under Russian Occupation
summary: The Russian authorities have seized on the crisis in Donetsk to argue that taking over the rest of the region from Ukraine would allow Moscow to restore the water supply.

title: How the Future of the Fed Came to Rest on Lisa Cook
summary: President Trump’s effort to oust the Federal Reserve governor has kicked off a landmark legal battle, one that will have far-reaching consequences for the institution’s independence.

title: PCE Inflation Stayed Stable in July, Keeping Fed on Track to Lower Interest Rates
summary: The latest economic data keeps the central bank on track to lower interest rates at its next meeting in September.

title: After Minneapolis Church Shooting, Families Seek Healing and Comfort
summary: Families and neighbors sought comfort on Thursday. “Give your kids an extra hug and kiss today,” the father of a victim said.

title: What We Know About the Minneapolis Catholic School Shooting
summary: The attack on a back-to-school Mass at Annunciation Catholic Church killed two children and injured 18 others. Investigators said the shooter’s writings and videos reflected violent obsessions.

title: The Overlooked Element to the ‘KPop Demon Hunters’ Phenomenon
summary: Beyond its catchy songs and memorable characters, the Netflix movie does an admirable job of capturing what it’s like to be an adoring fan.

title: ‘The Queen of Versailles’ Puts Her Life in the Hands of a ‘Wicked’ Diva
summary: A 2012 documentary asked if Jacqueline Siegel was a benefactor or victim of American greed. A new musical starring Kristin Chenoweth raises doubts.

title: International Student Enrollments Stay Steady at Columbia and Princeton
summary: But Black student enrollment is lower at the two universities after years of turmoil in elite higher education.

title: 20 Years After Katrina, New Orleans Is ‘at a Tipping Point’
summary: The city has taken pride in its ability to endure. But many residents, fed up with dysfunction and soaring costs, want it to strive for more.

title: 3 Ways Hurricane Forecasts Have Changed Since Katrina
summary: Modern technology has given meteorologists more detail than they’ve ever had on how storms behave. Here’s what they’re doing with it.

title: Israel Resumes Daytime Operations in Gaza City, Signaling Buildup to Assault
summary: The Israeli military ended a policy of pausing operations during the day that was intended to allow more aid in, calling Gaza City a “dangerous combat zone.”

title: Israel Military Says It Recovered Body of Ilan Weiss, Oct. 7 Victim, From Gaza
summary: Ilan Weiss, who was killed in the Hamas-led attack, and the remains of another person, who was not identified, were found as the government looks set to expand a military offensive.

title: Britain Bars Israeli Government From a Leading Arms Trade Fair
summary: The British government said it was acting in response to Israel’s escalating military operation in Gaza. Israel condemned the decision.

title: Iowa’s Joni Ernst Will Not Seek Re-election, Putting a Competitive Senate Seat in Play
summary: Democrats still face an uphill fight to win in Iowa and retake the majority in the closely divided Senate.

title: Gov. Greg Abbott Signs Gerrymandered Texas Map
summary: After a bruising political fight, Gov. Greg Abbott signed into law a new congressional map. But the Republican-led Legislature, newly emboldened, has not stopped there.

title: TSA PreCheck: Does It Really Save Time at the Airport?
summary: At the New York-area airports, for example, a lot depends on the terminal.

title: John Malone Helped Create the Modern Media Industry. He’s Not Sure We’re Better Off.
summary: John Malone helped create the modern media industry over the last half century. In a new memoir, “Born to Be Wired,” he looks back on what he has wrought.

title: Why the Texas Democrats’ Walkout Worked
summary: Losing loudly has been a crucial feature of successful political movements.

title: Los Angeles Wildfires Left the City With a Toxic Mess
summary: Urban wildfires are becoming public health emergencies.

title: Living With Katrina
summary: The storm made landfall 20 years ago today. What’s happened since then?

title: CVS and Walgreens Clamp Down on Covid Vaccines in Many States
summary: Because a C.D.C. panel has not yet recommended the shots, the country’s largest pharmacy chains are requiring prescriptions or holding back altogether under some state laws.

title: Looted by Nazis, a 17th-Century Painting Resurfaces. But Not for Long.
summary: The artwork had been missing for 80 years before Dutch journalists spotted it in a real estate listing in Argentina.

title: Alabama Man Once Barred From Office Is Elected Mayor
summary: Patrick Braxton won the first mayoral election in a half century in the small town of Newbern, five years after its leaders put up roadblocks to his assuming office.
